column4: finally. got it fixed. But now I have this one problem, I cant log back in to my own user because it gives off an 'no input supported' error
Is there a bleeping config file I can edit to fix my resolution settings?
wait, how did you fix it?
well, turns out that the wrong kernel interface was installed. and I had it all mixed up- All i really had to do was uninstall that and once again reinstall the binary nvidia drivers.
I had done it so many times, I actually lost track of it - and the last time I did uninstall it, it hadn't completed before I terminated the process.
so the question remains, there must be be some local user config thats messing up my login. gdm runs fine- good resolution. But as soon as I log in, i have no input signal supported.
Where'd I go to change that?
i believe its the one set from gnome-display-settings
are you logging into another user?
yeah, i've had two users. this is just a temporary one though.
well, i would suggest you to create a new user, and if that user works for you, then you should probably delete the configurations at home that relate to input and video stuff
then try to log into your old user
yeah, but what? i've already looked in .gnome2 and gnome2_private.
nothing in there that remotely registers with screen resolution / x config
no problem.. save all the configs of your applications you want (or even better, move all your directory to another one, for example $ mv /home/lilendian /home/lilendian/backup
the system will create a default configuration for you
